ci_support_linux_64_r_base4.4.yaml:
cdt_name:
- conda
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
cran_mirror:
- https://cran.r-project.org
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
pin_run_as_build:
  r-base:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
r_base:
- '4.4'
target_platform:
- linux-64

about.summary: Replace the standard x-axis in 'ggplots' with a combination matrix to visualize complex set overlaps. 'UpSet' has introduced a new way to visualize the overlap of sets as an alternative to Venn diagrams.  This package provides a simple way to produce such plots using 'ggplot2'.  In addition it can convert any categorical axis into a combination matrix axis.

Replace the standard x-axis in 'ggplots' with a combination matrix to visualize complex set overlaps. 'UpSet' has introduced a new way to visualize the overlap of sets as an alternative to Venn diagrams.  This package provides a simple way to produce such plots using 'ggplot2'.  In addition it can convert any categorical axis into a combination matrix axis.

name: r-ggupset
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = "0.4.1" %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-ggupset
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/ggupset_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/ggupset/ggupset_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: e87a0a2052a148f466e6eae7da969332a36cfe73724e90329f77de08181c7322

build:
  number: 1
  noarch: generic
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ posix }}zip               # [win]
    - cross-r-base {{ r_base }}    # [build_platform != target_platform]
  host:
    - r-base
    - r-ggplot2 >=3.3.0
    - r-gtable
    - r-rlang
    - r-scales
    - r-tibble
  run:
    - r-base
    - r-ggplot2 >=3.3.0
    - r-gtable
    - r-rlang
    - r-scales
    - r-tibble

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('ggupset')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('ggupset')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: https://github.com/const-ae/ggupset
  license: GPL-3.0-only
  summary: Replace the standard x-axis in 'ggplots' with a combination matrix to visualize complex set overlaps. 'UpSet' has introduced a new way to visualize the overlap of sets as an alternative to Venn diagrams.  This package provides a simple way to produce such plots using 'ggplot2'.  In addition it can convert any
    categorical axis into a combination matrix axis.
  license_family: GPL3
  license_file:
    - {{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/GPL-3

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r

# Package: ggupset
# Type: Package
# Title: Combination Matrix Axis for 'ggplot2' to Create 'UpSet' Plots
# Version: 0.1.0
# URL: https://github.com/const-ae/ggupset
# BugReports: https://github.com/const-ae/ggupset/issues
# Authors@R: person("Constantin", "Ahlmann-Eltze", email = "artjom31415@googlemail.com", role = c("aut", "cre"))
# Description: Replace the standard x-axis in 'ggplots' with a combination matrix to visualize complex set overlaps. 'UpSet' has introduced a new way to visualize the overlap of sets as an alternative to Venn diagrams.  This package provides a simple way to produce such plots using 'ggplot2'.  In addition it can convert any categorical axis into a combination matrix axis.
# License: GPL-3
# Encoding: UTF-8
# LazyData: true
# RoxygenNote: 6.1.1
# Depends: R (>= 2.10)
# Suggests: testthat
# Imports: ggplot2, gtable, grid, tibble, rlang, scales
# NeedsCompilation: no
# Packaged: 2019-03-01 15:51:35 UTC; constantin
# Author: Constantin Ahlmann-Eltze [aut, cre]
# Maintainer: Constantin Ahlmann-Eltze <artjom31415@googlemail.com>
# Repository: CRAN
# Date/Publication: 2019-03-06 13:30:03 UTC
